titleStmt.title: I prayed, at first, a little Girl,

publicationStmt.p: The Poems of Emily Dickinson, Johnson, 1955

lg.l: I prayed, at first, a little Girl,
Because they told me to --
But stopped, when qualified to guess
How prayer would soundsound feel -- to me --
If I supposedsupposed believed God looked around,
Each time my Childish eye
Fixed full, and steady, on his own
In solemn --solemn -- Childish honesty --
And told him what I'd like, today,
And parts of his far plan T
hat baffled me --
The furtherfurther under --under -- mingled side
Of his Divinity
And often since, in Danger, I
count the force 'twould be
To have a God so strong as that
To hold the lightthe light my life for me
Till I could Catch myCatch my take the Balance
That slips so easyslips so easy tips so frequent, now,
It takes me all the while to poise --
It isn't steady -- tho'It isn't steady -- tho' And then -- it does'nt stay --
